meanings.definition: To arrange again in a different order.
meanings.sent1: She reorders her books by color every month.
meanings.sent2: He reorders the numbers from smallest to largest.
meanings.sent3: The cat reorders the cushions on the couch for fun.
meanings.sent4: Time reorders our memories like a fickle librarian.
meanings.sent5: The wind reorders the fallen leaves into swirling patterns.

meanings.sent1: He reorders his favorite snack when it runs out.
meanings.sent2: She reorders the art supplies for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The dog reorders attention by wagging its tail enthusiastically.
meanings.sent4: Laughter reorders the atmosphere in the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The sun reorders the sky with its vibrant colors at dawn.

meanings.definition: To give a new order to.
meanings.sent1: The manager reorders the tasks for better efficiency.
meanings.sent2: She reorders the seating arrangement for the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician reorders the deck of cards with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: Music reorders the chaos of emotions into a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The chef reorders the ingredients to create a new recipe.
